page.title: 01General landscape, Rutland
page.content: The area is predominantly rural, but includes the villages of{Ayston,} {Preston}and Ridlington, as well as then northern tip of{Uppingham.}Much ofthe landscape is a patchwork of intensively cultivated fields. There is no extensive common land, bodies of water or woodland. The field boundaries are usually hedges; stone walls are rare. The major structural change in the last few years has been the building of the Uppingham by_pass,opened in June 1982. A Forestry Commission plantation, {Wardley Wood,}occupies the south_west corner. This wood used to be a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) but the extensive planting of conifers has decreased the natural history interest. A motte and bailey castle site overlooks the wood.
